Description: CSK Auto Corporation, a specialty retailer of automotive parts and accessories and formerly a publicly-traded company, agreed to pay a $20.9 million penalty to resolve alleged securities law violations stemming from a corporate earnings manipulation and double-billing scheme.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/csk-auto-corporation-agrees-pay-209-million-resolve-violations-securities-laws-related-scheme

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/9-12-14.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Notes: In 2001 the company paid $8.8 million to settle a series of class action lawsuits filed in several state courts in California concerning overtime pay for store managers and assistant store managers.

Private Litigation Case Title: Pearson et al v. CSK Auto, Inc.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 4413: Automotive Parts, Accessories, and Tire Stores

Description: The Missouri Court of Appeals upheld the jury award in ruling  No. WD77728.
Private Litigation Case Title: Kurt D. Ellison v. O'Reilly Automotive Stores Inc.
Info Source: https://caselaw.findlaw.com/mo-court-of-appeals/1695874.html

Company: O'Reilly Auto Enterprises, LLC et al.
Description: O'Reilly Auto agreed to pay $9.87 million in a settlement with 51 California District Attorneys of allegations it unlawfully disposed of hazardous waste from bins in its stores at unsuitable landfills throughout California.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2016/dec/oreilly_auto_parts_settlement#more
Notes: Riverside Country DA press release gives total settlement as $9.87 million.

Company: CSK Auto, Inc. dba O'Reilly Auto Parts, formerly Kragen Auto Parts.
Description: CSK Auto, Inc. agreed to pay more than $1.5 million in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys for San Bernardino, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz, counties along with the City Attorney of San Diego, that it charged customers more than the advertised or posted price for products at its check-out scanners, and that it failed to comply with the terms of its previous settlement in July 2008.
Info Source: https://www.sccgov.org/sites/da/newsroom/newsreleases/Pages/NRA2014/O'Reilly-Settles.aspx

Company: CSK Auto, Inc. dba Kragen Auto Parts.
Description: CSK Auto, Inc. agreed to pay $665,610 in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys for Santa Cruz, San Bernardino and Santa Cruz counties that it charged customers more than the advertised or posted price for products at its check-out scanners.
Info Source: https://www.sccgov.org/sites/da/newsroom/newsreleases/Pages/NRA2008/kragenautopartspay665000inpricescannercase.aspx
